intro: Erysimum molle, commonly known as the velvetleaf wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Erysimum molle is also valued for its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
